Because the mantra-holder does not violate the rules and diligently practices without interruption, one attains the name of practicing the bodhisattva's conduct through the gateway of mantras.

If during the time of counting, the appearance of signs, and so forth, the methods of recitation and practice are performed, and even if one cultivates the superior practices, one still does not attain accomplishment, one should be self-aware and redouble one's efforts, not giving rise to an inferior attitude and saying:
This Dharma is not suitable for me.
In this way, one should expand one's will and strength, always benefiting oneself and others, never passing the time in vain.

Because the practitioner is diligent and sincere, without resting, the profound illumination of the multitude of sages shines upon one's mind, and one is then blessed with their majestic spiritual establishment, attaining freedom from all obstructions.
Within this, there are two things that should not be abandoned:
Namely, not abandoning the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and the mind of benefiting sentient beings to the end.
Always being unshaken in the mind that aspires for omniscience, by these causes and conditions, one will definitely attain accomplishment and the siddhi of one's kind.
Always rely on the inner Dharma to bathe, do not cling to external pure dharmas,
Have doubts and regrets about the food of contact and so forth, such things should not be done.
If it is for the sake of sustaining this body, then bathe at the proper times and remove all impurities,
In accordance with the teachings on rivers and so forth, in union with the true words and mudras.
With the mind of the Dharma realm, purify all waters, and use the immovable one and the conqueror of the three times as appropriate,
The true words and secret mudras protect the directions, and one abides in the contemplation of one's own nature as the deity.
One should then hold the purified earth three times, always with a single-pointed mind and correct contemplation,
Recalling the true words and so forth of the holy immovable one, the wise one should bathe in silence.
The mind of the pure Dharma realm, the seed of the immovable one, and the knife mudra are all as explained before.

Here, the letter HA gate, the principle of sound as explained before,
With a slight difference, namely the characteristic of purification.
The honored one who conquers the three realms, the ritual of the body secret,
Should be used to accomplish activities, the mudras of the five wisdom vajras.
Next, the mantra of Trailokyavijaya is spoken:
Having bathed and sprinkled in this way, endowed with the pledge to protect the limbs,
Contemplate the immeasurable assembly of holy deities, and offer them water with cupped palms three times.
In order to purify body and mind and benefit others, respectfully bow to the Victorious Ones and their excellent offspring,
Far removed from the discrimination of the three poisons and so forth, with the faculties tranquil, go to the meditation chamber.
Either relying on a water chamber or other skillful means, the mind abides as previously instructed,
The body's three parts are taken as the measure, in order to seek the superior, middling, and inferior teachings.
The practitioner thus performs recitation, all wrongdoing will be permanently stopped,
Certainly accomplishing the removal of all obstacles, the words of omniscience gather in the body.
